creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: colorful image of village buildings on the side of a mountain, looking upward; white stucco buildings with orange terra cotta tile roofs; balconies with potted plants; three animal-shaped multicolored piñatas in LRC; woman, man and boy wearing colorful garments, seen from back, with a dog, LLQ; woman in red shirt walking down stairs in LLQ; sign on building at bottom:  "CERAMICA ARTIST / Los Castillo]
marks: Signature, Title and Date LLC below image, in black: [Taxco, Mexico]; LRC be
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Taxco, Mexico
